alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 10:34AM EDT until August 06 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following county, Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area in the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Bandy, Bee Lick, Pulaski and Eubank. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
